section.name: Overview
section.p:
ThruZero Commons (tz-commons) is a collection of Java components I've developed over the years (since about 2002) while creating various websites and services. The components are reusable and many components are extensions to or leverage existing open source components.
ThruZero Commons is divided into the following modules:
tz-commons-core: Basic low-level components (e.g., Config, ConfigLocator, ServiceLocator, InfoNodeElement)
tz-commons-domain: Focuses on common Services (e.g., PreferenceService, SettingService and InfoNodeService)
tz-commons-domain-jpa: JPA-based implementations of DAOs, using Hibernate.
tz-commons-domain-hibernate: Hibernate-based implementations of DAOs.
tz-commons-domain-dsc: DSC-based implementations of domain DAOs.
tz-commons-auth: Basic authentication and authorization services (Shiro integration)
tz-commons-auth-jpa: JPA-based implementations of auth DAOs.
tz-commons-auth-hibernate: Hibernate-based implementations of auth DAOs.
tz-commons-auth-dsc: DSC-based implementations of auth DAOs.
tz-commons-web: Basic Utils and filters useful to the web tier.
tz-commons-jsf: Basic Utils useful to JSF apps

body.section:
There's a sample application:
pf-test18 [Desktop]: A PrimeFaces test application, for desktop browsers, configurable for JPA, Hibernate, DSC file system or DSC web service. It tests tz-commons using some of the following PrimeFaces components:
Accordion Panel (using JPA and DSC concurrently)
Carousel Panel
RSS Feed
Chart
Map
Galleria
Image Switch
Plus, some custom tools:
Guest Book
Escape Utility
Authentication test (Shiro integration)
